The firm's V3 model operates at a lower cost than R1, web and app access remain free for many users, and developers benefit from discounted rates during off-peak hours. Its strategic pricing aims to expand market reach rather than maximize immediate profits.

articles.title: Indiaspora summit in Dubai spotlights AI's breakneck evolution
articles.author: Ab Wire
articles.summary: Dubai's Museum of the Future hosted the Indiaspora's first-ever AI Summit 2025. It brought together global AI experts from Silicon Valley, the United Arab Emirates, India and beyond to discuss how nations can navigate the fast-evolving AI landscape amid groundbreaking investments in infrastructure.

articles.title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff says company won't need as many human workers
articles.summary: Marc Benioff, CEO of Salesforce, believes that artificial intelligence will replace humans in the workplace in the future. Ann Skeet, senior director of leadership ethics at the Markkula Center, thinks it's unfortunate that he refers to AI agents as digital workers.

articles.title: OpenAI, in deep trouble
articles.author: Gary Marcus
articles.summary: The early reviews of GPT 4.5 have been brutal. This was OpenAI's best shot post DeepSeek to show that they are still the king, but they swung and missed. Altman was the right CEO to launch ChatGPT, but he may not have the intellectual vision to get them to the next level.

articles.title: Fayetteville Public Schools wants input on future AI use
articles.author: Justin Trobaugh
articles.summary: Fayetteville Public Schools plans multiple engagement opportunities over its approach to artificial intelligence. The district will introduce a district-wide AI vision statement that aims to incorporate the perspectives of students, families, staff, and community members. Focus groups will be held in April. ILO Group, an education strategy and policy firm launched AiLO in 2024.

articles.title: Data quality key to good AI-generated content
articles.author: China Daily
articles.summary: The rise of artificial intelligence-generated content (AIGC) is transforming the digital economy in China and the rest of the world. AIGC is fueled by breakthroughs in AI technologies, such as generative models and natural language processing.

articles.title: Elon Musk says there's ‘only a 20% chance of annihilation' with AI
articles.summary: The probability of a good outcome of AI is 80%, according to Musk. He was involved with OpenAI to create a 'non-profit open source AI' that was 'the opposite of Google'. This led him to create Grok, which is a'maximally truth-seeking AI'

articles.title: Sponsored Content: AI is here to stay.
articles.author: Richmond Biz Sense
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming industries by automating processes, improving decision-making and enhancing customer experiences. Businesses are leveraging AI to drive revenue and reduce operational costs. Adopting AI without a clear strategy can lead to wasted investment, security vulnerabilities and poor integration with existing systems. Organizations must establish AI governance frameworks, including an AI Steering Committee and an AI Acceptable Use Policy.

articles.title: Microsoft's Magma AI Can Help Robots See and Understand
articles.author: Samantha Kelly
articles.summary: Magma is a new artificial intelligence model designed to help robots see, understand and act more intelligently. Microsoft partnered with researchers from the University of Maryland, University of Wisconsin-Madison and University of Washington to develop it. Forrester predicts 25% of 2025 robotics projects will combine cognitive and physical automation.

articles.title: Texas mulls limiting health insurance artificial intelligence
articles.author: Phil Prazan
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is becoming a larger part of life, including in the healthcare industry. Doctors worry it can be used to tee-up claim denials. Texas lawmakers in Austin will debate whether to limit the technology and by how much. The bill was left pending in committee waiting for further debate and discussion.

articles.title: Elon Musk says there's 'only a 20% chance of annihilation' with AI
articles.author: Ana Altchek
articles.summary: Elon Musk has a glass-half-full mentality when it comes to AI. He thinks AI will be smarter than humans and pose an existential risk. He expects AI to reach a level that is "smarter than all humans combined" in 2029 or 2030.

articles.title: Prompt Engineering For Advanced Multi-Agent AI Prompting
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: In today's Forbes column, I identify and showcase a new prompting approach that serves to best make use of multi-agentic AI. The world is headed toward having a zillion agentic AI agents that do this or that. There will be more AI agents than you can poke a stick at. The good news is that there will be plenty of agentic AIs to choose from.

articles.title: MIT Researchers Reveal AI's Good And Bad Impact On Jobs And Skills
articles.author: Dr. Diane Hamilton
articles.summary: AI is reshaping how businesses function, but the real question is how it will change them. MIT researchers reveal AI's good and bad impact on jobs and skills, highlighting how it reshapes the workforce in ways we might not expect. AI helps lower-skilled workers, but it does not do much for high-skilled ones. Companies need to think carefully about how they use AI, or they risk losing the knowledge that once set them apart.

articles.title: Book Review: ‘The Infinite Retina' (Second Edition) By Irena Cronin And Robert Scoble
articles.author: Charlie Fink
articles.summary: Robert Scoble and Irena Cronin have written The Infinite Retina (Second Edition) about Spatial Computing, AI, the Metaverse, self-driving cars, virtual beings, and the ways technology will shape the rest of our lives. It's an expansive, highly readable survey of the forces shaping our digital future.

articles.title: AI Is Changing How We Learn: The New Role Of Human Teachers

articles.title: How AI Can Help Employees Recognize Communication Blind Spots At Work
articles.author: Dr. Diane Hamilton
articles.summary: AI-powered systems analyze tone, pacing, and engagement in real time. Professor Alex Pentland's research shows that AI can help employees recognize blind spots in their communication. Many companies are integrating AI-driven coaching tools to help employees improve their workplace communication. Success depends on how the technology is introduced and whether employees see it as a tool for growth rather than surveillance.

articles.title: 5 AI Stocks To Buy Ahead Of The Stargate AI Project

articles.summary: Stargate AI Project aims to create a universal protocol for interacting AI models, enabling different machine learning systems to leverage each other's capabilities without custom integration work. The project could dramatically accelerate development cycles and reduce costs. NVIDIA stands to benefit from the project due to its central position in the AI computation infrastructure landscape.
